N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22 ยง 202.40 - Jury trial of less than all issues; procedure

State Regulations

Unless otherwise ordered by the court, whenever a trial by jury is demanded on less than all issues of fact in an
action, and such issues as to which a trial by jury is demanded have been
specified in the note of issue or in the jury demand, as the case may be, served and filed pursuant to section
202.21
of this Part, the court
without a jury first shall try all issues of fact as to which a trial by jury
is not demanded. If the determination of these issues by the court does not
dispose of the action, a jury shall be empanelled to try the issues as to which
a trial by jury is demanded. Notes
